intro: [WRONG START] Hieracesium issenii, commonly known as the Issen's hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Central Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and ragworts. The plant typically grows in meadows and grasslands, preferring well-drained soils. It produces yellow flowers with a central disc, and its leaves are usually lance-shaped with hairy surfaces. Hieracium issenii is often found in open habitats and can thrive in both full sun and partial shade.
